Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; exterior: part of black band above frieze with black-figure decoration consisting of panther to right (head, neck, shoulders, forelegs and part of torso remaining; with added red on neck and torso); below, black, with traces of red and added white bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit does not make any mention as to whether or not the interior of the vessel is glazed.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 65, pl. 51, no. 228)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 222)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.207) (phase 3)
